TextView.android:text: Dindi, Andhra Pradesh \n A picturesque coastal village with serene backwaters and tranquil atmosphere
Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh \n Scenic hill town, source of Narmada River, spiritual destination
Lambasingi, Andhra Pradesh \n Referred to as the Kashmir of South India due to its cool climate and occasional snowfall
Yaganti, Andhra Pradesh \n Famous for its unique Sri Uma Maheshwara Temple, Carved out of a single rock
Namsai, Arunachal Pradesh \n Known for its lush green landscapes and rich cultural heritage
Sangti Valley, Arunachal Pradesh \n Pristine landscapes, wildlife sanctuary, and serene riverside tranquility
Tawang, Arunachal Pradesh \n Experience closeness to nature like never before
Majuli, Assam\n the world's largest river island and a hub of Assamese culture and biodiversity
Panimur Waterfalls, Assam \n Nature's beauty unveiled through cascadinf waters and lush forests
Sonbhandar Caves, Bihar \n Hidden treasures, history and spirituality beneath the earth
Telhar Kund, Bihar \n A serene natural wonder, known for its picturesque landscapes and tranqualility
Sirpur, Chhattisgarh \n Ancient ruins, Buddhist heritage, archaeological treasures and cultural exploration
Chitrakote, Chhatishgarh \n Majestic waterfall, lush forests and cultural richness make it a captivating destination
Arvalem Caves, Goa\n Serene caves, lush landscapes, ancient temples and tranquil waterfalls
Cotigao Wildlife Sanctury, Goa \n Lush forests, diverse fauna, serene ambiance - nature's haven
Lothal, Gujrat \n Ancient port city, Indus Valley site, archaeological marvel
Mandvi Beach, Gujrat\n Serene shores, camel rides, seafood delights. Relaxation awaits
Patan, Gujrat \n Renowned for its exquisite Rani ki Vav stepwell, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Sai Ka Angan, Haryana\n Serene, spiritual, cultural, vibrant, tranquil and scenic pilgrimage destination
Kasol, Himachal Pradesh \n Serene village nestled in Parvati Valley, famous for scenic beauty
Malana, Himachal Pradesh \n Remote village in Himachal, known for unique culture
Shikharji, Jharkhand \n Sacred Jain pilgrimage site, renowned for natural beauty
Chitradurga, Karnataka \n Rich heritage, ancient forts, vibrant culture and scenic landscapes
Kudremukh, Karnataka \n Lush forests, stunning trekking trails, and breathtaking Western Ghats beauty
Shivanasamudra Falls, Karnataka \n Majestic cascades, serene landscapes, captivating natural beauty
